--0-1807123718-1197297944=:75893
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Looks like you had 3,989 jobs stuck in memory. If I'm reading the memory dump correctly.

I still haven't learned how to read the order.xml files, but I would assume that your job is branching to other domains until it runs out of memory.

I did notice that you have seed-redirect-new-seed set to true. Maybe someone else can explain what impact that setting has?

hinoglu <hinoglu@...> wrote:                               Hi,
 
 setup a linux 2.6.18 debian box last night running heritrix 1.12.1 on
 sun jdk1.6.0_03 with 1100 Mbs of heap size (-Xmx1100M).
 had my crawl job creating script setup to allow max 4 instances
 running at the same time. one of the instances is heritrix instance
 itself, the other 3 are created and assigned one job each by using jmx
 client interface during runtime. heritrix instance is not assigned any
 job, just used for monitoring the processes. and when the job
 finishes, controller script sends a destroy command to relevant instance. 
 
 last time this setup worked for almost one week without stack errors.
 this time i got outofmemoryerror in 7 hours.
 
 this is jmap -histo output.
 http://www.students.itu.edu.tr/~altunyurt/heritrix_jmap_output.txt
 
 and order.xml
 http://www.students.itu.edu.tr/~altunyurt/order.xml
 
 any suggestions?
 
 
     
                               

       
---------------------------------
Never miss a thing.   Make Yahoo your homepage.
